text: Dominique Fils-Aimé is a Canadian singer from Quebec, whose album Stay Tuned! was shortlisted for the 2019 Polaris Music Prize"Dominique Fils-Aimé nommée sur la courte liste du prix Polaris". Voir, July 16, 2019. and won the Juno Award for Vocal Jazz Album of the Year at the Juno Awards of 2020.Shakiel Mahjouri, "2020 Juno Awards Winners List: Find Out Who Came Out On Top". ET Canada, June 29, 2020. Born and raised in Montreal to immigrant parents from Haiti, Fils-Aimé was a competitor in the third season of TVA's singing competition series La Voix in 2015."Dominique Fils-Aimé: suivre sa voix". La Presse, January 3, 2018. She was eliminated in the semi-final round by Matt Holubowski. In 2018 she released Nameless, her debut album which explored blues music as the first installment in a trilogy devoted to the history of African-American music."Dominique Fils-Aimé lance «Nameless»". Le Devoir, March 27, 2018. Stay Tuned!, which explores jazz music, followed in 2019 as the second album in the trilogy,"Dominique Fils-Aimé talks about her northern soul and SLAV". Montreal Gazette, February 27, 2019. with the forthcoming third album slated to delve into contemporary soul, hip hop, funk and rhythm and blues. ==References== Category:21st-century Canadian singers Category:Canadian female pop singers Category:Canadian blues singers Category:Canadian female jazz singers Category:Canadian soul singers Category:Canadian rhythm and blues singers Category:Black Canadian singers Category:Black Canadian women Category:Canadian people of Haitian descent Category:Singers from Montreal Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Juno Award for Vocal Jazz Album of the Year winners Category:21st-century Canadian women singers
title: Dominique Fils-Aimé
